KnowledgeBase.Title: isCharName
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector ByteVector Text Boolean
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isType isChar isCharAlphanumeric isCharLowercase isCharAlphabetic isCharNumeric isCharUppercase isCharWhitespace isString isText
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: Character Alphabetic Object Uppercase Lowercase Name Underscore Numeric Alphanumeric Name Whitespace Boolean

Function.Description: The isCharName function returns true if every character in the argument is an alphanumeric or an underscore character; otherwise false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isCharName function returns true if every character in the argument {obj} is an alphanumeric or an underscore character. Otherwise the isCharName function returns false.
Brief.Usage: The isCharName function function is used to query an object to see if it contains alphanumeric or underscore characters.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes: Character String Symbol Vector ByteVector Text Boolean

Syntax.Return: If the object contains only alphanumeric or underscore characters, true is returned. Otherwise false is returned.
